Class BibCreator

  • java.lang.Object
    • BibCreator

  • public class BibCreator
extends java.lang.Object

    BibCreator Class (Driver)

    The purpose of this program is to review some concepts covered in class previously concerning Exception Handling and File I/O. For this assignment, we had to create a BibCreator class which reads from Bib files containing one or more articles and created 3 types of formatted bibliographies (IEEE, ACM, and NJ) which are written in JSON output files. The program also lets the user review any of the JSON files
    Author:
    Abhijit Gupta, Student: 40066502 COMP249
    Assignment 3
    Due date: Monday, March 19th, 2018

      • getAuthors

        public static java.lang.String getAuthors(java.lang.String s)
                                   throws FileInvalidException
        Used to get the values of author (names) stored in file.
        Parameters:
        String - s, is the String line read by the scanner. It is passed to this method for processing.
        Returns:
        String containing all the authors separated by '#' or returns null if passed parameter does not contain author.
        Throws:
        FileInvalidException - with message "author" if author field is empty.

        public static java.lang.String formatIEEE(java.lang.String a,
                                          java.lang.String j,

                                          java.lang.String volume,
                                          java.lang.String number,
                                          java.lang.String page,
                                          java.lang.String month,
                                          java.lang.String year)

        j - String containing journal acquired by get().

        volume - String acquired by get().
        number - String acquired by get().
        page - String acquired by get().
        month - String acquired by get().
        year - String acquired by get().
        Returns:
        returns these values formatted according to IEEE standard.

      • processFilesForValidation

        public static int processFilesForValidation(java.io.PrintWriter pw1,
                                            java.io.PrintWriter pw2,
                                            java.io.PrintWriter pw3,
                                            java.util.Scanner sc,
                                            int count,
                                            int invalids,
                                            java.io.File f1,
                                            java.io.File f2,
                                            java.io.File f3,
                                            java.io.File fread)
        Processes each of these files to find out whether it is valid or not. If a file is valid it creates the proper records for each of the 3 formats (IEEE, ACM and NJ) and store them in these files. If a file is invalid, it stops the processing of this file only, throws and FileInvalidException to display the exception error message, then display a message indicating which file was detected as invalid, and where the “first” problem in that file was detected. The corresponding output file is then deleted. The method will then continue with the processing of the following files.
        Parameters:
        pw1 - PrintWriter writing IEEE file
        pw2 - PrintWriter writing ACM file
        pw3 - PrintWriter writing NJ file
        sc - Scanner reading from input files.
        count - count of how many files are/to read.
        invalids - count of how many invalid files.
        f1 - IEEE output file.
        f2 - ACM output file.
        f3 - NJ output file.
        fread - current file being read.
        Returns:
        int, number of invalid files.

      • printFromFile

        public static void printFromFile(java.io.BufferedReader br)

        Parameters:
        br - Buffered Reader

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method Displays everything needed for user interactions. Initializes all the parameters required for passing onto other methods ( PrintWriters, Scanner, BufferedReaders, etc.). Calls all other methods.
        Parameters:
        args -
